info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 3:41PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Berks, south central Lehigh and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 340 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pottstown, or 12 miles east of Reading, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pottstown, Birdsboro, Kutztown, Fleetwood, East Greenville, Topton, Bally, Bechtelsville, Lyons, Geryville, Gilbertsville, Stowe, Boyertown, Pennsburg, Red Hill, St. Lawrence, Pottsgrove, Lorane, Reiffton and Amity Gardens. This includes Northeast Extension near mile marker 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for eastern and southeastern Pennsylvania.
